events.event_name: Bank of England interest rate decision
events.description: The Bank of England is expected to announce its decision on interest rates, with a consensus expectation to maintain the rate at 3.75%.

facts.fact_text: The FTSE 100 traded lower on Thursday.

evidences.evidence_text: The FTSE 100 traded lower on Thursday after hitting a record high in the previous session

facts.fact_text: Vodafone shares fell nearly 5% following its service revenue report.

evidences.evidence_text: Vodafone led declines, falling almost 5% after reporting slower than expected service revenue growth

facts.fact_text: Shell announced a $3.5 billion share buyback program.

evidences.evidence_text: the group announced another $3.5 billion share buyback

facts.fact_text: Anglo American reduced its copper production forecast for 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: Anglo American slipped about 1% after cutting its 2026 copper production forecast

facts.fact_text: BT shares increased by more than 1% after its trading update.

evidences.evidence_text: BT rose more than 1% after a trading update showed third quarter adjusted EBITDA in line with estimates

claims.claim_text: Investors are exhibiting caution due to the upcoming Bank of England decision.

evidences.evidence_text: investors turned cautious ahead of the Bank of England decision

claims.claim_text: The Bank of England is expected to maintain interest rates at 3.75%.

evidences.evidence_text: Bank of England decision expected to keep rates on hold at 3.75%

evidence.evidence_text: investors turned cautious ahead of the Bank of England decision expected to keep rates on hold at 3.75%
The FTSE 100 traded lower on Thursday... as investors turned cautious ahead of the Bank of England decision
Vodafone led declines, falling almost 5% after reporting slower than expected service revenue growth
Anglo American slipped about 1% after cutting its 2026 copper production forecast due to weaker expected output from Chile
